Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 49cfb138af156020599361584b20c9ed591eeeb6
I did basic sanity testing checking for logs appearing in the way they should ideally appear
you have missed a change here
LG2 doesn't support template as of now as it works during compile time only
I am also confused if these are mixed up in this file. Please check
This commit is only migration to lg2, improvision of logs will be  addressed in different commit
+1 . This should have been std::cerr in the original file also
+1. s original file should have been std::cerr
This would be an error, not an info log
+1 . u can make lines similar to this alert also
can you add one example for how previously traces looks and after migrating to LG2 how traces looks?
Think its best to test each type (info, error, alert)of for in two places at atleast.
In general please re-check on the inclusions of ""#include <phosphor-logging/lg2.hpp>"" as it is not required to be added in all places (Through chain inclusions it will get included automatically).
There are lot of places where , we have additional new lines added, where the logging header is not included e.t.c please fix them in all of the places.

This commit also need another change that would add phosphor-logging as dependency for pldm package to be build in the pldm recipe file https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-phosphor/recipes-phosphor/pldm/pldm_git.bb#L3

Without that change, merging this change would break the full image builds.
why do you need phosphor-logging dependency for tests ? I dont think tests use any sort of logging ? its just PASS or FAIL.
It doesn't automatically picks up the dependency and few cpp and header files that are being included in the test files need lg2 that should be explicit be stated in the dependency section
remove tabs here . run clang on this file
we dont need phosphor-logging-dep for tests, please remove this change.
It doesn't automatically picks up the dependency and few cpp and header files that are being included in the test files need lg2 that should be explicit be stated in the dependency section
this is error trace inside exception block
This commit is only migration to lg2, improvision of logs will be  addressed in different commit
+1, please remove all empty lines in all the files.
This does not seem to be an exact migration ? why did we add nextRecordHandle ?
this is info trace but logging as error trace.
This commit is only migration to lg2, improvision of logs will be  addressed in different commit
same comment here too..logging not needed for test.
It doesn't automatically picks up the dependency and few cpp and header files that are being included in the test files need lg2 that should be explicit be stated in the dependency section

#include <phosphor-logging/lg2.hpp>
file is not included, is it fine?
No need to add it here as that might have included already with existing includes
same comment here too. include what you use, dont rely on other headers.

#include <phosphor-logging/lg2.hpp>
file is not included, is it fine?
That header file is already being included with "requester/handler.hpp" so no need to add it in this file

NO, this is not the right way @jay.

always include what you use. Dont rely on this to be provided by a different header file. If that header file is removed, then this will break.

If you could have included this file at "commom/utils/hpp" we could have avoided unwanted inclusions in other files including this line.

Its always a best practice to limit the unwanted header file inclusions by adding in common places.

This document https://github.com/include-what-you-use/include-what-you-use/blob/master/docs/WhyIWYU.mdb says other way. Following which I have implemented the changes in all files by adding include for logging api, irrespective of the dependencies in hpp files

#include <phosphor-logging/lg2.hpp>
file is not included, is it fine?
Not needed to have circular inclusions of header file

This document https://github.com/include-what-you-use/include-what-you-use/blob/master/docs/WhyIWYU.mdb says other way. Following which I have implemented the changes in all files by adding include for logging api, irrespective of the dependencies in hpp files

#include <phosphor-logging/lg2.hpp>
file is not included, is it fine?

This document https://github.com/include-what-you-use/include-what-you-use/blob/master/docs/WhyIWYU.mdb says other way. Following which I have implemented the changes in all files by adding include for logging api, irrespective of the dependencies in hpp files
do we need a type cast here ?
the structure where effecter_id is declared is a __attribute__((packed)) due to which lg2 throws an error - cannot bind packed field ‘pdr->pldm_state_effecter_pdr::effecter_id’

#include <phosphor-logging/lg2.hpp>
file is not included, is it fine?

This document https://github.com/include-what-you-use/include-what-you-use/blob/master/docs/WhyIWYU.mdb says other way. Following which I have implemented the changes in all files by adding include for logging api, irrespective of the dependencies in hpp files

#include <phosphor-logging/lg2.hpp>
file is not included, is it fine?

This document https://github.com/include-what-you-use/include-what-you-use/blob/master/docs/WhyIWYU.mdb says other way. Following which I have implemented the changes in all files by adding include for logging api, irrespective of the dependencies in hpp files
this should be info . See base file this line is std::cout NOT std::cerr
this should be error ? original file has std::cerr
why is this still info? any reason why this cant be changed to error
why are other dependencies being touched ? please revert back them to how they were earlier. and just add logging.
ideally the traces only should have been modified ? why is it the entire lambda is being modified? is it some sort of clang-format thing ?
why is the new line being removed, please add it back
Changes look good other than those No new line comments in a few files.
why is static_cast<> being changed to C style casting ?
lets not change casting style as part of this commit.
nit: this seems a little redundant - in future we could add boolalpha support in phosphor-logging , so that we can remove this redundant code from clients.
please prefer c++ casting if lg2 does not support.
This conversion seems a little un-necessary. why are we doing it the way we are doing it ?
